headline: Paramount sweetens WBD buyout offer, Spotify surges on user growth
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Paramount Skydance (PSKY) upping its buyout offer to Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) with a new "ticking fee," Spotify (SPOT) shares surging in Tuesday's premarket after reporting record user growth in its fourth quarter and full-year 2025, and Harley Davidson (HOG) stock dropping after releasing sales figures that fell below expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Paramount sweetens WBD buyout offer, Spotify surges on user growth

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery stock rises after Paramount sweetens takeover offer
summary: Investing.com -- Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ:WBD) stock rose 2% Tuesday after Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ:PSKY) enhanced its $30 per share all-cash takeover offer with additional financial incentives.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery stock rises after Paramount sweetens takeover offer
content.summary: Investing.com -- Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. (NASDAQ:WBD) stock rose 2% Tuesday after Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ:PSKY) enhanced its $30 per share all-cash takeover offer with additional financial incentives.

headline: PARAMOUNT ENHANCES ITS SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY AND PROVIDES UPDATE ON REGULATORY PROGRESS
summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today announced it has amended its $30 per share, all-cash tender offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") with enhancements that surpass the standard needed for the WBD Board to engage on Paramount's superior proposal.

content.title: PARAMOUNT ENHANCES ITS SUPERIOR $30 PER SHARE ALL-CASH OFFER FOR WARNER BROS. DISCOVERY AND PROVIDES UPDATE ON REGULATORY PROGRESS
content.summary: Paramount Skydance Corporation (NASDAQ: PSKY) ("Paramount") today announced it has amended its $30 per share, all-cash tender offer to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc. (NASDAQ: WBD) ("WBD") with enhancements that surpass the standard needed for the WBD Board to engage on Paramount's superior proposal.

headline: Paramount Sweetens Warner Offer
summary: The media company, which is pursuing a hostile bid for Warner, also said it complied with Justice Department request for information about its proposed deal.

content.title: Paramount Sweetens Warner Offer
content.summary: The media company, which is pursuing a hostile bid for Warner, also said it complied with Justice Department request for information about its proposed deal.

headline: Paramount sweetens Warner Bros bid with ticking fee, Netflix break-up fee cover
summary: Paramount Skydance has enhanced its Warner Bros Discovery bid by offering extra cash for each quarter the deal fails to close after this year and agreed to cover the breakup fee the HBO owner would owe Netflix if it walked away.  Even though Paramount did not raise ​its per-share offer, the sweeteners mark the company's latest attempt to woo Warner Bros shareholders in its prolonged battle with Netflix for control of some of the world's most ‌prized TV and film assets.  The CBS parent has offered a 25-cent per share "ticking fee" that will equal to about $650 million in cash each quarter between the start of 2027 and the close of a deal with Warner Bros, Paramount said ‌in on Tuesday.

content.title: Paramount sweetens Warner Bros bid with ticking fee, Netflix break-up fee cover

Even though Paramount did not raise ​its per-share offer, the sweeteners mark the company's latest attempt to woo Warner Bros shareholders in its prolonged battle with Netflix for control of some of the world's most ‌prized TV and film assets.  The CBS parent has offered a 25-cent per share "ticking fee" that will equal to about $650 million in cash each quarter between the start of 2027 and the close of a deal with Warner Bros, Paramount said ‌in on Tuesday.
